page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: During the period after the First World War the only industry was the Cement works. A lot of the housing was built by the Cement Works for their employees. The bulk of the accomodation in the village during this period was made up of council housing and the property built for the Cement Works. Private housing extended along the length of the main road running East to West through the village known as { {Fontygary Road.} The outlying areas of the village was agricultural land. For a full account of what the area was like before industrial development we suggest you consult a book called.. {"STUDIES OF FIELD SYSTEMS IN THE {BRITISH ISLES" }ed. A.R.H.Baker and R.A.Butlin C.U.P.(1973) pp.497-503.
